fields.name: French_Press
fields.description: Method where uzing special brewing device. Coffee is brewed by placing coarsely ground coffee in the empty beaker and adding hot water, in proportions of about 30 g of coffee grounds to 500 ml of water, more or less to taste. Plunging slowly is purported to maximize the extraction of the oils and flavonoids from the ground bean.

fields.name: Espresso
fields.description: Espresso machines work by pushing highly pressurized hot water through grounds that have been tightly packed into a portafilter.

fields.name: Pourover
fields.description: To brew pour-over coffee, set up the pour-over on top of a mug and add a paper filter. The medium grounds go inside the filter, and then you pour boiling water on top.

fields.name: Eastern
fields.description: Eastern brewing method uses  a long-necked coffee pot named Jazve . This method produces a drink that strong, flavorful, and very frothy.
